get.summary: Generates a dynamic image from text

parameters.name: fontcolor
parameters.description: The color of the text, in hex format, without the #.

parameters.name: fontsize
parameters.description: The size of the text, in points.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Either vertical or horizontal, default horizontal.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The image width in pixels (or height if the direction is vertical).

post.summary: Updates logged user's profile information

firstname.description: The first name of the user.

middlename.description: The middle name of the user.

lastname.description: The last name of the user.

homephonenumber.description: The home phone number of the user.

get.summary: Gets the logged in user account.
View a list of users
get.description: Allows the user to view the full list of users and is based on role permissions.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

parameters.name: roleid
parameters.description: The id of the role to filter users by, or empty to return all users.

parameters.name: onlywithoutcard
parameters.description: If is 1 then only the users without a card are returned, otherwise all users are returned.

parameters.name: photosize
parameters.description: The size in pixels of the photo URLs returned. Defaults to 40. If the size specified is not available, a similar one will be returned.

zipcode.description: The zip code of the user.

parameters.description: The user ID to directly associate the upload photo. If not specified, a temp ID is returned that can be later specified in 'user.save'.

parameters.name: automatch
parameters.description: Set this to true to find the specific user based on the file name.

parameters.description: The source key of the selected template data source.

parameters.description: True if all the templates should be placed in the same file, false if each one shoud be in its own file.

parameters.description: Only the template for these users is created (and emailed if 'email' is true), enter multiple separated by commas.

parameters.description: It specifies the purpose of the creation of the templates. If true then is for sending via e-mail, otherwise is just for downloading

parameters.description: When printing all badges, filter by person type, can be either: attendee, presenter or exhibitor

sendonscreendefault.description: Specifies whether the notifications assigned to this topic have to have the on-screen delivery enabled by default.

enableemaildelivery.description: Specifies whether the notifications assigned to this topic can be sent via e-mail or not.

sendemaildefault.description: Specifies whether the notifications assigned to this topic have to have the e-mail delivery enabled by default.

enablesmsdelivery.description: Specifies whether the notifications assigned to this topic can be sent via sms or not.

sendsmsdefault.description: Specifies whether the notifications assigned to this topic have to have the sms delivery enabled by default.

get.summary: Send notifications on screen, via email or text to users

parameters.description: Comma-separated Ids of users to send the notification.

parameters.description: Comma-separated Ids of user groups to send the notification.

parameters.description: Whether to display the notification on screen.

parameters.description: Whether to send the notification via text message.

parameters.description: What to do when the notification is clicked. Valid values: hide, view, url.

parameters.description: Url to redirect the user, if onscreenclick=url.

parameters.description: How to display the notification. Valid values: info, success, warning, error

parameters.description: Time in seconds to display the notification.

parameters.name: showonstation

parameters.description: Reply-to email.

delete.description: Allows the user to delete an existing rule.

parameters.description: The id of the rule to save (leave empty to create a new one).

onevent.description: The event that will trigger this rule.

conditionsjson.description: The conditions that apply to this rule.

actionsjson.description: The actions that will be executed when this rule matches.

active.description: Specifies if the action is active or inactive

parameters.name: event

parameters.description: If true only failed requests will be returned

parameters.description: The http status to filter the requests

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

get.summary: Import data into AccuTraining
get.description: Allows the user to import data into AccuTraining via CSV or flat files either manually or automatically using the import utility.

parameters.name: importtype
parameters.description: The kind of data that is being uploaded.

parameters.name: upload
parameters.description: Set 'file' as value to indicate that a file is being submitted in the body (instead of a JSON object).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The local name of the uploaded file. For later reference.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Import parameters, in a key-value pair JSON-serialized object. Eg {'parameter':'value'}.

get.summary: Lists available import types
Search and view details of a course
get.description: Allows the user to view an individual course and its details.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the event to get.

post.summary: Create or edit a course
post.description: Allows the user to create or edit a course.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the event to save (leave empty to create a new one).

code.description: The unique code of the event.

recurringschedule.description: The recurring schedule of the event, a JSON-formatted array. Each item must contain an action (set/remove) and the schedule properties, as returned by event.get.

onetimeschedule.description: The one-time schedule of the event, a JSON-formatted array. Each item must contain an action (set/remove) and the schedule properties, as returned by event.get.

delete.description: Allows the user to delete an existing course.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the event to delete.

get.summary: View a list of courses by date
get.description: Allows the user to view a list of courses by date.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location to filter the events.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date to filter the events. Today will be used if this parameter is omitted.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of event to list.

get.summary: View a list of courses
get.description: Allows the user to view the full list of courses.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

parameters.name: summaryonly
parameters.description: True to return only the event information and not the associated schedule, dept, etc. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: termid
parameters.description: Id of the term to list the events. Null to list all events.

get.summary: Searches for the available event groups

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to search event groups.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the group to delete.

get.summary: Search and view details of a user group
get.description: Allows the user to view a user group and its details.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the user group to get.

post.summary: Create or edit a group
post.description: Allows the user to create a new group or edit a group that they have permission to edit.

parameters.description: The id of the group to save (leave empty to create a new one).

isprivate.description: Whether this group can be seen by others other than the creator.

viewroles.description: The roles that can view the group, in JSON format.

editroles.description: The roles that can edit the group, in JSON format.

scopes.description: The scopes that have access to this group, in JSON format.

get.summary: View a list of user groups

parameters.description: The id of the user to remove.

delete.description: Allows the user to delete an existing attendance log.

get.description: Allows the user to view an individual attendance log and its details.

post.summary: Create or edit an attendance log
post.description: Allows the user to create or edit an attendance log.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the room to save (leave empty to create a new one).

cardnumber.description: The card # of the user (used when the user is unknown).

user.description: The id of the user, or a CSV list of ids if creating new logs.

location.description: The id of the location where the user signed in.

event.description: The id of the event the user signed in to.

useeventschedule.description: Specifies whether the event schedule should be used to set the log status.

publicnotes.description: Specifies whether the notes are public to the user or should only be seen by staff or admins

logdetails.description: The log details in JSON format

get.summary: View a list of attendance logs
get.description: Allows the user to view the list of all attendance logs in the location or locations in which the user is scoped.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter the logs, valid values are: invalid, not-signed-in, not-signed-out, stayed-less-than-required, out-of-event, valid.

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: The user ID of the user to get the logs.

get.summary: Gets the attendance logs of the current user

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter the logs, valid values are: invalid, not-signed-in, not-signed-out, stayed-less-than-required, out-of-event, valid.

get.summary: View who's in a location
get.description: Allows the user to view the Who's In page and view all users who are logged into locations in which the user is scoped.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The id of the location to search for users that are in.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The id of the event to search for users that are in.

parameters.name: sorting
parameters.description: Field to sort by. Either first-name, last-name or sign-in-time.

parameters.name: roles
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of ids of the roles to search for users that are in.

parameters.name: photosize
parameters.description: The size in pixels of the photo URLs returned. Defaults to 40. If the size specified is not available, a similar one will be returned.

parameters.name: extensions
parameters.description: A JSON array containing the extension filters (i.e [{name: 'nametofilter', value: 'valuetofilter'}]).

parameters.name: export
parameters.description: True to export the results as CSV

get.summary: Sign out an attendance log
get.description: Allows the user to sign out am attendance log from the Who's In page.

parameters.description: The id of the attendance log to sign-out.

parameters.description: The id of the location to filter the users to sign out.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The id of the event to filter the users to sign out.

parameters.name: datetime
parameters.description: Specifies the date and time when the specified logs have to be signed out.

type.description: Specifies the attendance type (0 = Sign-In, 1 = Sign-Out). If not specified then it's inferred from existing logs.

cardnumber.description: The number of the swipped card.

location.description: The id of the location whose swipe has to be saved.

event.description: The id of the event whose swipe has to be saved.

client.description: The unique id of the client whose swipe has to be saved.

clientname.description: The name of the client whose swipe has to be saved.

metadata.description: The swipe's metadata in JSON format.

attendancelog.description: The id of the attendance log that has to be commented.

comments.description: The comments that have to be saved.

public.description: Specifies whether this comment is public to the user or should only be seen by staff or admins

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: A pipe separated list of the parameters. Example: key1=value1|key2=value2|key3=value3

get.description: Allows the user to view the complete list of available, canned reports.

get.summary: Queries and loads the specified report, in background.
get.description: Allows the user to run reports, in background, with the exception of attendance analytics reports.

parameters.name: reportname
parameters.description: The name of the report to execute

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: A pipe separated list of the parameters. Example: key1=value1|key2=value2|key3=value3

parameters.name: repformat
parameters.description: The format of the resulting report. Json, pdf, csv, ...

parameters.name: fillgroupid
parameters.description: If specified, the result is used to fill the group with the given ID

parameters.name: groupby
parameters.description: How to group the records. In the format 'col1+col2|col3+col4

parameters.name: refreshgroup
parameters.description: The ID of the group to check (and refresh) before processing the report.

parameters.name: filtertext
parameters.description: The user friendly text of the applied filters.

get.summary: View a list of all his memorized reports
get.description: Allows the user to view the list of all memorized reports that they have created.

parameters.description: If specified filters the memorized reports by custom name.

parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

get.description: Allows the user to view an individual memorized report and its details.

post.summary: Create or edit a memorized report
post.description: Allows the user to create or edit a memorized report for themselves.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the report settings to save (leave empty to create a new one).

internalname.description: The internal name of the report.

customname.description: The custom name of the report.

customdescription.description: The custom name of the report.

format.description: The default format of the report.

params.description: A pipe separated list of the parameters. Example: key1=value1|key2=value2|key3=value3.

filters.description: A JSON containing the selected filters.

filtertext.description: The user friendly text of the applied filters.

groupby.description: How to group the records. In the format 'col1+col2|col3+col4

name.description: The friendly name of the sign-in station.

mode.description: The mode of the sign-in station.

title.description: Title to display in the station.

instructions.description: Instructions to display in the station.

passcode.description: The passcode used to change settings in the station, empty text to disable security.

location.description: Id of the location Title to display in the station.

showids.description: Whether to show the visitor ids in the sign-in station.

shownames.description: Whether to show the visitor names in the sign-in station.

showphotos.description: Whether to show the visitor photos in the sign-in station.

infotimeout.description: Specifies how much time the success or error message is shown after a swipe.

photopixelwidth.description: Specifies the pixel width of the photos in the sign-in station.

allowcreatingvisitors.description: Whether to allow creating visitors from the sign-in station.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

post.summary: Saves a task plan

id.description: The id of the Task to save (leave empty to create a new one).

name.description: The name of the task plan.

description.description: The description of the task plan.

validfrom.description: The date when the plan starts.

validto.description: The date when the plan ends.

tasks.description: The task definitions in JSON format.

groups.description: A CSV list of the group ids this plan is assigned to.

get.summary: Lists task types or definitions
Lists the task plans of the logged user
View details of a role
get.description: Allows the user to view a role and its details.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the location to get.

delete.description: Allows the user to delete a role from the list of available roles.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the location to delete.

post.summary: Create or edit a role
post.description: Allows the user to create or edit a role's permissions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the role to save (leave empty to create a new one).

description.description: The description of the role, for admin use.

viewroles.description: CSV list of the roles this role can view.

editroles.description: CSV list of the roles this role can edit.

get.summary: Lists the roles for the current account

parameters.name: includepolicies
parameters.description: True to include the policies, defaults to false.

parameters.name: includeinternal
parameters.description: True to include the internal roles too.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by name of the role.

get.summary: View a list of role templates
get.description: Allows the user to view the full list of available role templates.

get.summary: Lists the maps a roles is mapped to

parameters.name: roleid
parameters.description: The id of the role to list the maps.

get.summary: Lists the roles mappings

parameters.name: map
parameters.description: List only the roles in the specified map.

post.summary: Saves a role mapping
post.description: Allows the user to add a role to a mapped category on the 'Role Mapping' page.

map.description: The map name to save the role.

delete.description: Allows the user to delete a role from its mapped categories on the 'Role Mapping' page.

map.description: The map name to save the role.

get.summary: Checks the permissions are assigned for the given roles

parameters.name: roles
parameters.description: CSV list of the role ids to check

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: CSV list of the permissions to check

get.summary: Adds the missing permissions to a role. Requires access to advrole.save

parameters.name: roles
parameters.description: CSV list of the role ids to check

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: CSV list of the permissions to check

get.summary: List users. Alias to user.list, use that one instead.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first record to return.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The max number of records to return.

parameters.name: roleid
parameters.description: The id of the role to filter users by, or empty to return all users.

parameters.name: onlywithoutcard
parameters.description: If is 1 then only the users without a card are returned, otherwise all users are returned.

parameters.name: photosize
parameters.description: The size in pixels of the photo URLs returned. Defaults to 40. If the size specified is not available, a similar one will be returned.

get.summary: Upgrade a user to another role (requires permission to edit those roles)
get.description: Allow the user to add a role to another user, given that he has access to view that other user and edit people with that new role.

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: Id of the user to upgrade

parameters.name: roleid
parameters.description: Id of the role to add

get.summary: Returns the list of permissions for a specific user

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: User ID to list the effective permissions.

get.summary: Returns the list of permissions for a specific role

parameters.name: roleid
parameters.description: Role ID to list the effective permissions.

get.summary: Returns the list of users for a specific permission

parameters.name: commandname
parameters.description: Name of the action or command to get the roles.

get.summary: Returns the list of users for a specific user

parameters.name: locationid
parameters.description: Location ID to list the users with that scope.

get.summary: Permissions by user report
get.description: Lists all the users in the system including their corresponding permissions.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: A pipe separated list of the parameters. Example: key1=value1|key2=value2|key3=value3

get.summary: List the sessions available for a specific event
get.description: Allows the user to view all the sessions available for a recurring event.

parameters.name: eventid
parameters.description: The event id to list sessions.

parameters.name: sessiondate
parameters.description: The date of the session to find.

get.summary: View a list of upcoming event sessions
get.description: Allows the user to view the full list of upcoming events.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Only sessions in the week of the specified date will be returned.

get.summary: View a list of upcoming sessions of a particular event
get.description: Allows the user to view the upcoming recurring sessions of a specified event.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Start date to filter the returned sessions.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The id of the event whose sessions will be returned

get.summary: Lists the registrations for a specific session
get.description: Allows the user to view the registration for a specified event session.

parameters.name: eventid
parameters.description: The event id to list sessions.

parameters.name: sessiondate
parameters.description: The date of the session to find.

get.summary: Register users for events
get.description: Allows the user to register another user for an upcoming event.

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: The id of the user to add.

parameters.name: eventid
parameters.description: The id of the event.

parameters.name: sessiondate
parameters.description: The date and time when the session starts.

get.summary: Register current user to an event session
get.description: Allows the user to register themselves for an event.

parameters.name: eventid
parameters.description: The id of the event.

parameters.name: sessiondate
parameters.description: The date and time when the session starts.

get.summary: Removes a user from an event session
get.description: Allows the user to un-register another user from an event.

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: The id of the user to remove.

parameters.name: eventid
parameters.description: The id of the event.

parameters.name: sessiondate
parameters.description: The date and time when the session starts.

get.summary: Unregister current user from an event session
get.description: Allows the user to un-register themselves from an event.

parameters.name: eventid
parameters.description: The id of the event.

parameters.name: sessiondate
parameters.description: The date and time when the session starts.

get.summary: Lists the registrations for a specific user
get.description: Allows the user to view the session registrations for a specified user, provided they have the ability to view that user.

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: The user id to list sessions.

get.summary: View all the sessions the logged user is registered to

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Start date to filter the sessions.

get.summary: Get the settings for session registration
get.description: Allows the user to view a event's session registration settings.

parameters.name: locationid
parameters.description: The id of the location to save settings.

parameters.name: eventid
parameters.description: The id of the event to save settings.

parameters.name: sessiondate
parameters.description: The date and time when the session starts.

parameters.name: noinherit
parameters.description: True to get the location/event/session specific settings without looking for the more global settings.

post.summary: Save the settings for an event's session registration
post.description: Allows the user to save the settings for an event.

locationid.description: The id of the location to save settings.

eventid.description: The id of the event to save settings.

sessiondate.description: The date and time when the session starts.

enabled.description: Whether the registration is enabled or not.

showupcomingdays.description: # of days to show upcoming sessions

registernolessdurationbasis.description: Specifies the time unit of measurement to restrict the period when attendees can register to sessions (no less than 0 = Minutes, 1 = Hours, 2 = Days, 3 = Weeks).

registernolessduration.description: Specifies the duration of the period when attendees can register to sessions (no less than the specified magnitude).

registernomoredurationbasis.description: Specifies the time unit of measurement to restrict the period when attendees can register to sessions (no more than 0 = Minutes, 1 = Hours, 2 = Days, 3 = Weeks).

registernomoreduration.description: Specifies the duration of the period when attendees can register to sessions (no more than the specified magnitude).

unregisternolessdurationbasis.description: Specifies the time unit of measurement to restrict the period when attendees can unregister from sessions (no less than 0 = Minutes, 1 = Hours, 2 = Days, 3 = Weeks).

unregisternolessduration.description: Specifies the duration of the period when attendees can unregister from sessions (no less than the specified magnitude).

remindhours.description: Specifies the hours before the event when the reminder is sent.

success.description: Specifies if the execution of the action was successful

message.description: Message with context information about the response

success.description: Specifies if the execution of the action was successful

message.description: Message with context information about the response

error_flag.description: Error flag that describes the error in the execution

domain.description: Contains the domain of the account where the action was applied on

redirect_url.description: Contains the url to redirect to when an error is found during the execution of the action

ErrorActionResult.description: Object returned when the action execution failed

bearerAuth.description:
Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. 

Enter 'Bearer' [space] and then the token returned by the 'login' endpoint.

Example: "Authorization: Bearer xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
